intro: Forchhammeria lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf forchhammeria, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or arid environments. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and delicate blooms. Due to its limited natural range, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
